item.title: Roche to Boost Pipeline With Telavant Buy
item.description: Roche has agreed to buy Telavant Holdings from Roivant Sciences and Pfizer in a deal worth over $7 billion that will bolster its immunology pipeline.

item.title: Gold Settles But Geopolitical Risk Demand Remains
item.description: Gold prices pulled back slightly n early London trading, but upside remains strong due to the conflict in Gaza.

item.title: US Dollar Seen Steady for Now on Light Agenda
item.description: The dollar was relatively steady against major currencies as investors’ fears about Middle East tensions ebb for now, and Monday’s light agenda could keep the U.S. currency hugging tight ranges, UniCredit Research said.

item.title: Oil Slips as Investors Keep Close Eye on Middle East
item.description: Oil prices fell around 1% in Europe, with investors keeping a close eye on the conflict in Israel and Gaza, as humanitarian aid started to filter into the Palestinian territory.

item.title: Italian BTPs Outperform Peers After S&P Affirms Rating, Outlook
item.description: Italian government bonds were outperforming eurozone peers after S&P affirmed Italy’s “BBB” rating with a stable outlook..

item.title: Telecom Italia to Evaluate KKR Bids
item.description: Telecom Italia said its board will meet next month to consider KKR’s binding offer for its fixed-network business and its nonbinding bid for the stake in Sparkle.

item.title: Nikkei Falls 0.8%, Dragged by Electronics, Steel Stocks
item.description: Japanese stocks ended lower, dragged by falls in electronics and steel stocks as concerns persist about higher costs of energy and borrowing amid the Middle East conflict.

item.title: Philips Upgrades Outlook After Strong Third Quarter
item.description: Philips said it expected adjusted earnings to rise 10%-11% for the year, after reporting above-forecast third-quarter results, helped by €258 million of cost savings, with its restructuring and productivity plans on track.

item.title: Israel-Hamas War Revives Interest in U.S. Production of Iron Dome Missiles
item.description: U.S. invested in a homegrown system better suited for potential conflict in the Pacific than in the Middle East.

item.title: Intrepid Investors Look for Bargains in Ukraine---Bomb Shelter Required
item.description: The battered country is luring investments with the chance to help in the war against Russia and score assets on the cheap.

item.title: Fed Rate Moves Squeeze a Key U.S. Ally
item.description: South Korea’s alliance with the U.S. has strengthened during the Biden presidency. But the country’s economy has fallen victim to the rapid rise in U.S. interest rates.

item.title: Tim Cook Can't Make iPhones Without This Chinese Company and Its CEO
item.description: Apple is increasingly reliant on China-based Luxshare for manufacturing amid U.S. tensions with Beijing.

item.title: The film actors union and major studios and streamers are returning to the negotiating table Tuesday in an effort to end a monthslong strike that has brought TV and film production to a halt.
item.description: The film actors union and major studios and streamers are returning to the negotiating table Tuesday in an effort to end a monthslong strike that has brought TV and film production to a halt.

item.title: Energy producers are sparring over subsidies from the climate law, afightthat pits the Biden administration's goals for growth against its efforts to reduce emissions.
item.description: Energy producers are sparring over subsidies from the climate law, a fight that pits the Biden administration’s goals for growth against its efforts to reduce emissions.

item.title: Consumers who have absorbed big price increases are growing more cautious, pressuring sales of everything from frozen meals to pet food and prompting food companies to offer more deals.
item.description: Consumers who have absorbed big price increases are growing more cautious, pressuring sales of everything from frozen meals to pet food and prompting food companies to offer more deals.

item.title: The candidate of Argentina's ruling Peronist party surprisingly finished ahead of a libertarian in the first round of the presidential election. The runoff will be Nov. 19.
item.description: The candidate of Argentina’s ruling Peronist party surprisingly finished ahead of a libertarian in the first round of the presidential election. The runoff will be Nov. 19.

item.title: Venezuela's release of five political prisoners after a deal with the U.S. has given hope to the families of others detained by Maduro's regime.
item.description: Venezuela’s release of five political prisoners after a deal with the U.S. has given hope to the families of others detained by Maduro’s regime.

item.title: Meta is wrestling with how to enforce its content rules amid the Israel-Hamas war as hateful comments have surged through Instagram.
item.description: Meta is wrestling with how to enforce its content rules amid the Israel-Hamas war as hateful comments have surged through Instagram.

item.title: FTX founder Bankman-Fried is weighing perhaps his biggest gamble yet: Whether to testify in his own defense at his federal fraud trial after prosecutors wrap up their own case.
item.description: FTX founder Bankman-Fried is weighing perhaps his biggest gamble yet: Whether to testify in his own defense at his federal fraud trial after prosecutors wrap up their own case.

item.title: A feature to alert pilots of potential runway crashes is widely available, but in many cases, isn't turned on, as regulators have been reluctant to require its use.
item.description: A feature to alert pilots of potential runway crashes is widely available, but in many cases, isn’t turned on, as regulators have been reluctant to require its use.
